thread.title: Merced woman arrested in Angels Camp
thread.title_full: Merced woman arrested in Angels Camp

title: Merced woman arrested in Angels Camp
text: Merced woman arrested in Angels Camp Merced woman arrested in Angels Camp By Union Democrat staff October 21, 2015 01:00 am A woman from Merced was arrested Saturday night after a traffic stop in Angels Camp. An Angels Camp Police officer pulled over the driver of a Toyota Tacoma about 4:10 p.m. for expired registration on South Main Street near Monte Verda Street, an Angels Camp Police Department press release stated. The driver was found to be driving on a suspended license and then gave the officer permission to search the Tacoma. About 4.6 grams of methamphetamine and a .38 caliber revolver were located inside the Tacoma. Denis Aanonson, 51, of Merced, was cited and released on charges of possession of controlled substances, driving on a suspended driverâ€™s license and expired registration. Aanonson was booked into Calaveras County Jail on suspicion of being a felon in possession of a firearm and was still being held Tuesday afternoon at the jail on $15,000 bail. Follow UnionDemocrat.com
